message.content:
<<<api>>>: StringTokenizer.nextToken
<<<code>>>: import java.io.*;
import java.util.*;

public class Test {
    public static void main (String [] args) throws IOException {
        BufferedReader f = new BufferedReader(new FileReader("src/test.in.txt"));
        PrintWriter out = new PrintWriter(new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter("src/test.out.txt")));
        StringTokenizer st = new StringTokenizer(f.readLine());
        int i1 = Integer.parseInt(st.nextToken());    // first integer
        int i2 = Integer.parseInt(st.nextToken());    // second integer
        out.println(i1+i2);                           // output result
        out.close();                                  // close the output file
    }
}
<<<explanation>>>: The issue you are facing is related to the file path. When you specify "test.in.txt" as the file path, Java looks for the file in the project's root directory. If your file is located in the bin folder, you need to specify the correct path. In the provided code, I have assumed that your files are located in the src folder of your project, so I have updated the file paths to "src/test.in.txt" and "src/test.out.txt". If your files are located in a different folder, you should update the paths accordingly.
